content:
Google pays Mozilla, for it's placement in the Firefox product.

Thunderbird is in a separate company from Firefox, has no such arrangement.
creator: wsmwk

content: Fixed... For the record, if anyone else encounters something like this then it can be turned off from the menu bar via File > Subscribed.

content: We would have no idea about that. I suggest you log into your online account to see if the message was received. Also, some software vendors are slow in sending confirmation messages. And a further comment is that your email host may have thought the message was spam.

content:
From Help > Troubleshooting Information, please post the value of :

  • Update Folder
  • Application
  • Profile folder (Sanitize if needed)
creator: wsmwk

content:
Update Folder - C:\ProgramData\Mozilla-1de4eec8-1241-4177-a864-e594e8d1fb38\updates\8216C80C92C4E828

Application - C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe

Profile Folder - Contents ? Value - 4ddni481.default

does that help ? or do you need an image of the directories ?
creator: agf38

content:
Thanks.

In current versions, the normal default location for profile will have "default-release" in the name. Do you see such a directory in file explorer? And is there data there?
creator: wsmwk

content: Hi - there is no directory by that name "default-release" - the only one that is close is the 4ddni481.default folder, which sits under Appdata/roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles - 4ddni481.default houses many folders - blocklists, browser-extension-data, mail, ImapMail, settings folder etc and 145 files many of which are xxx.v2.sqlite, and xxx.v3.sqlite.
creator: agf38

content:
Thank you for that research. Sounds like all the files are probably there. But prefs.js gets corrupted or is missing.

Does the problem reproduce if you have started WINDOWS 10 in safe mode? https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode
